page.title: 13Buxton:Rail Transport.
page.content: Buxton has an hourly train service to and from Manchester. During the morning and evening periods the trains run every half hour. People going to work, students, schoolchildren, shoppers, and tourists use the train, and it is important in the Buxton winter when the roads are blocked by snow and ice. Buxton people also work on the mineral railways which take stone away from Hindlow, Topley Pike and Tunstead Quarries. The line to Hindlow crosses the Buxton streets on a mighty viaduct. Peak Rail is a private steam railway which is growing at the old Midland Station. In 1985 they have some small working steam locomotives,and some larger ones they hope to restore.They want to run trains on the old route to Matlock.
